intro: Crudia unifoliolata, commonly known as the single leaf cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its solitary, sessile leaf that is often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Africa. Due to its unique morphology, it is of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
